# Analysis of "ðŸ’»â”‚developers" Discord Chat

## 1. Summary
The discussion primarily revolves around Hyperfy's plugin system, development tools, and platform identity. Key technical topics include:

Plugin injection technology was discussed as a way to manage mod conflicts, with peezy working on converting mods to use this system. The approach uses an "inject" method rather than directly modifying app and world objects, though conflicts can still occur when multiple mods add systems to createClientWorld/createServerWorld.

A significant development was peezy's implementation of MCP (Model-Code-Prompt) on cursor, enabling live code updates between the IDE and Hyperfy worlds. This allows developers to modify app scripts on the fly without copy-pasting, creating a bridge between cursor and Hyperfy.

Ashxn announced rigidbody physics improvements with addForce() and addTorque() methods, with plans for addForceAtPos() in the future. Shiffty demonstrated these capabilities with a ball camera implementation that enables golf, bowling, and similar physics-based games.

The chat also included extensive discussion about Hyperfy's messaging and identity challenges, with users noting difficulties in explaining what Hyperfy is to newcomers. The community debated whether Hyperfy should be presented as a game engine, platform, or sandbox, with Ashxn describing it as "a meta game engine" that "replaces offline editing with live collaboration and a portable object format."

## 2. FAQ
Q: How does the plugin injection system work compared to directly modifying app and world objects? (asked by peezy) A: It uses an "inject" method instead of directly modifying objects, which helps avoid conflicts, though systems added to createClientWorld/createServerWorld can still conflict (answered by Ashxn)
Q: Can we add forces to rigidbodies? (asked by Shiffty) A: Yes, rigidbody.addForce(force: Vector3) and rigidbody.addTorque(force: Vector3) are live, with rigidbody.addForceAtPos(force, pos) planned for future vehicle implementations (answered by Ashxn)
Q: How does the MCP on cursor work? (asked by Ashxn) A: It adds MCP functionality to the server with tools for querying the database and changing entity scripts, allowing live code updates between cursor and Hyperfy (answered by peezy)
Q: Does first person mode work in v2? (asked by Gooey) A: It works and can be set up for the player or on an app (answered by drdoge.eth)
Q: Is there scene management in Hyperfy? (asked by bear) A: Unanswered directly, though Omka mentioned glb animations for cut scenes and idle cam

# Analysis of âš¡â”‚general Channel

## 1. Summary
The chat primarily revolves around users seeking help with Hyperfy's development platform, particularly regarding its technical capabilities and limitations. A user named "treed" asked several questions about implementing Three.js code in Hyperfy, revealing that while Hyperfy is built on Three.js, not all Three.js functionality is currently exposed to developers. Peezy explained that developers typically drag and drop GLB models and then add code to them, with some Three.js primitives like Vector3 being available but not all Three.js objects yet. The conversation highlighted that AI integration is a significant focus for Hyperfy, with multiple resources available. There was also brief discussion about Hytopia (formerly NFT Worlds) as a potential competitor to Hyperfy. The chat showed some tension when treed felt ignored after asking technical questions in the general channel rather than the dedicated help channel.

## 2. FAQ
Q: Is this ok that I don't see apps? (asked by treed) A: You have to make apps. Worlds don't come with any preinstalled. (answered by á²¼)
Q: In v2, seems like there is no option to additionally make a glb a collider? (asked by treed) A: Unanswered
Q: Can anyone just give me couple of working simple codes (rotating object, changing color) so I can have samples to start from? (asked by treed) A: Check out all .hyps for examples (answered by mattimus)
Q: Are there any plans to integrate AI here? (asked by early) A: Yes, multiple resources available including guides at hyperfy.how (answered by Omka)
Q: Is hytopia a competitor to hyperfy? (asked by johan) A: Yes, they're building something like Minecraft without licensing issues with a Roblox spin; they were formerly NFT Worlds (answered by Ashxn and bear)
Q: How do I create a world so I can create own stuff? (asked by Terry) A: Check out https://hyperfy.how (answered by bear)
